Name: Methanobacterium aarhusense
Main publication: A.Shlimon et al.,  2004,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 54,  p. 759
Description: Sediment cores collected in Aarhus Bay, a semi-enclosed embayment on the east coast of Jutland, Denmark (56° 09' N, 10° 19' E)

Name: Methanobacterium alcaliphilum
Main publication: S. Worakit et al.,  1986,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 36,  p. 380
Description: Sediment samples collected from four Egyptian lakes of the Wadi el Natrun.

Name: Methanobacterium arcticum
Main publication: V. Shcherbakova et al.,  2011,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 61,  p. 144
Description: Sample isolated from a sample of 2.0 m deep Holocene permafrost sediments, Kolyma lowland, Russia (70°06’N, 154° 04’E).

Name: Methanobacterium beijingense
Main publication: K. Ma et al.,  2005,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 55,  p. 325
Description: Sample isolated from an anaerobic digester for the treatment of beer-manufacture wastewater.

Name: Methanobacterium bryantii
Main publication: W. Balch et al.,  1979,  Microbiol. Rev.,  vol. 43,  p. 260
Other publication: K. Krivushin et al.,  2010,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 60,  p. 455
Additional growth requierments: Yeast extract, acetate, cysteine, Fe, W, Ni
Description: Native unpolluted groundwater samples from the Floridan Aquifer near West Palm Beach, Florida (USA).

Name: Methanobacterium congolense
Main publication: N. Cuzin et al.,  2001,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 51,  p. 489
Description: Sample from anaerobic digestor treating raw cassava peel.

Name: Methanobacterium espanolae
Main publication: G. Patel et al.,  1990,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 40,  p. 12
Description: Sample from the anoxic zone of the primary sludge of the E. B. Eddy Forest Products Ltd. (Espanola, Ontario, Canada) bleach kraft mill.

Name: Methanobacterium ferruginis
Main publication: K. Mori et al.,  2011,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 61,  p. 138
Description: Sample from the interior surface of a pipe transporting natural gas- containing brine in the southern Kanto gas field in Japan.

Name: Methanobacterium flexile
Main publication: J. Zhu et al.,  2011,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 61,  p. 2974
Description: Sediment samples collected from Gahai lake, Qaidam Basin.

Name: Methanobacterium formicicum
Main publication: M. Bryant et al.,  1987,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 37,  p. 171
Description: Sample obtained from a domestic sewage sludge digestor in Urbana, Ilinois.

Name: Methanobacterium ivanovii
Main publication: M. Jain et al.,  1987,  Syst. Appl. Microbiol.,  vol. 9,  p. 77
Description: Sample from rock core.

Name: Methanobacterium kanagiense
Main publication: K. Kitamuraet al.,  2011,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 61,  p. 1246
Description: Sample from a rice field plot at Kanagi Farm of the Teaching and Research Center for Bio-coexistence, University Farm, Faculty of Agriculture and Life Science, Hirosaki University.

Name: Methanobacterium lacus
Main publication: G. Borrel et al.,  2012,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 62,  p. 1625
Description: Sample isolated from the profundal sediment of the meromictic Lake Pavin, France.

Name: Methanobacterium movens
Main publication: J. Zhu et al.,  2011,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 61,  p. 2974
Description: Sediment samples collected from Tuosu lake, Qaidam Basin.

Name: Methanobacterium movilense
Main publication: J. Schirmack et al., 2014,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 64,  p. 522
Description: Sample of sediment of the subsurface lake from Movile Cave, near the city of Mangalia, Romania.

Name: Methanobacterium oryzae
Main publication: C. Joulian et al.,  2000,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 50,  p. 525
Description: Sample from a rice field soil in the Philippines (Pila area, Luzon Province).

Name: Methanobacterium palustre
Main publication: G. Zellner et al.,  1988,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 151,  p. 1
Description: Sample isolated from marshland of the Sippenauer Moor, Germany (48°53' N 11°57' E).

Name: Methanobacterium petrolearium
Main publication: K. Mori et al.,  2011,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 61,  p. 138
Description: Sample from sludge deposited in a crude oil storage tank in Japan.

Name: Methanobacterium subterraneum
Main publication: S. Kotelnikova et al.,  1998,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 48,  p. 357
Description: Sample of granitic rock groundwater from the Äspö hard rock laboratory tunnel, South-Eastern Sweden (depths 68 m, 409 m and 420 m).

Name: Methanobacterium thermaggregans
Main publication: K. Blotevogel et al.,  1985,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 142,  p. 218
Description: Sample of cattle pasture mud.

Name: Methanobacterium uliginosum
Main publication: H. Konig,  1987,  Can. J. Microbiol.,  vol. 30,  p. 1477
Description: Sample of a marshy soil.

Name: Methanobacterium veterum
Main publication: K. Krivushin et al.,  2010,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 60,  p. 455
Other publication: E. Rivkina et al.,  2007,  FEMS microbiology ecology,  vol. 61,  p.1
Description: Samples selected from deep (28 m beneath surface) late Pliocene permafrost 26 (Kolyma lowland, 70°06’N, 154° 04’E).

Name: Methanobrevibacter acididurans
Main publication: D. Savant et al.,  2002,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 52,  p. 1081
Description: Laboratory anaerobic reactor treating distilary wastewater seeded with sludge from filed digester.

Name: Methanobrevibacter arboriphilus
Main publication: J. Zeikus et al.,  1975,  Antonie Van Leeuwenhoek,  vol. 41,  p. 543
Description: Samples of a wetwood cores from Wisconsin, and western cottonwood trees located on the banks of Cottonwood Creek in Grand Teton National Park in Wyoming.

Name: Methanobrevibacter boviskoreani
Main publication: J. Lee et al.,  2013,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 63,  p. 4196
Description: Sample from rumen of the Korean native cattle (HanWoo,  Bos taurus coreanae) in South Korea.

Name: Methanobrevibacter curvatus
Main publication: J. Leadbetter et al.,  1996,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 62,  p. 3620
Min. growth requierments: Casamino acids, yeast extract, rumen fluid
Other substrate: not supporting:theobromine, theophyline, trimethoxybenzoate, lactate, pyruvate, glucose
Description: Hindgut contents of the termite Reticulitermes flavipes.

Name: Methanobrevibacter cuticularis
Main publication: J. Leadbetter et al.,  1996,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 62,  p. 3620
Other substrate: not supporting:theobromine, theophyline, trimethoxybenzoate, lactate, pyruvate, glucose
Description: Hindgut contents of the termite Reticulitermes flavipes (Kollar) (Rhinotermitidae).

Name: Methanobrevibacter filiformis
Main publication: J. Leadbetter et al.,  1998,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 169,  p. 287
Other substrate: not supporting:theobromine, theophyline, trimethoxybenzoate, lactate, pyruvate, glucose
Description: Hindgut contents of the termite Reticulitermes flavipes.

Name: Methanobrevibacter gottschalkii
Main publication: T. Miller et al.,  2002,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 52,  p. 819
Description: Sample of horse feaces.

Name: Methanobrevibacter millerae
Main publication: S. Rea et al.,  2007,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 57,  p. 450
Description: Sample of bowine rumen contents.

Name: Methanobrevibacter olleyae
Main publication: S. Rea et al.,  2007,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 57,  p. 450
Min. growth requierments: acetate, yeast extract, trypticase, coenzyme M, branched-chain
Description: Sample of sheep rumen contents.

Name: Methanobrevibacter oralis
Main publication: A. Ferrari et al.,  1994,  Curr. Microbiol.,  vol. 29,  p. 7
Description: Subgingival samples from ten healthy volontiers (Italy).

Name: Methanobrevibacter ruminantium
Main publication: H. Smith et al.,  1958,  J. Bacteriol.,  vol. 75,  p. 713
Description: Sample from bovine rumen.

Name: Methanobrevibacter smithii
Main publication: W. Balch et al.,  1979,  Microbiol. Rev.,  vol. 43,  p. 260
Description: Sample of primary sewage digester (USA).

Name: Methanobrevibacter thaueri
Main publication: T. Miller et al.,  2002,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 52,  p. 819
Description: Sample of cow feaces.

Name: Methanobrevibacter woesei
Main publication: T. Miller et al.,  2002,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 52,  p. 819
Description: Sample of goose feaces.

Name: Methanobrevibacter wolinii
Main publication: T. Miller et al.,  2002,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 52,  p. 819
Min. growth requierments: acetate, yeast extract, trypticase, coenzyme M, branched-chain
Description: Sample of sheep feaces.

Name: Methanocalculus chunghsingensis
Main publication: M. Lai et al.,  2004,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 54,  p. 183
Description: Samples from an estuary in Eriln Shi, near Wang-gong, Taiwan.

Name: Methanocalculus halotolerans
Main publication: B. Ollivier et al.,  1998,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 48,  p. 823
Description: Sample collected from the well-head of the Scheibenhardt NDL 103 oilfield in Alsace (France).

Name: Methanocalculus natronophilus
Main publication: T. Zhilina et al.,  2014,  Microbiology,  vol. 82,  p. 698
Description: Samples taken from bottom sediments of Tanatar soda lakes (Altai, Russia) and from the collectors in the vicinity of these lakes.

Name: Methanocalculus pumilus
Main publication: K. Mori et al.,  2000,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 50,  p. 1723
Description: Leachate samples taken from pipes (25 cm in diameter), used for monitoring sinkage and water quality, at the Osaka North Port Sea-Based Solid-Waste-Disposal Site in Japan.

Name: Methanocalculus taiwanensis
Main publication: M. Lai et al.,  2002,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 52,  p. 1799
Description: Samples from water of an estuary in Eriln Shi near Wong-Kong, Taiwan.

Name: Methanocaldococcus fervens
Main publication: C. Jeanthon et al.,  1999,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 49,  p. 583
Additional growth requierments: yeast extract, casamino acids, tripticase, selenite, tungsten
Description: Samples from deep-sea hydrothermal vent core sample from Guaymas Basin, Gulf of California, at a depth of 2003 m.

Name: Methanocaldococcus indicus
Main publication: S. L Haridon et al.,  2003,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 53,  p.1931
Description: Chimney sample collected in April 2001 at the Kairei vent field on the Central Indian Ridge (25°19' S, 70°02' E) at a depth of 2420 m.

Name: Methanocaldococcus infernus
Main publication: C. Jeanthon et al.,  1998,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 48,  p. 913
Description: Chimney sample collected from the Logatchev hydrothermal field (14° 45' N, 44° 59' W) on the Mid-Atlantic Ridge at a depth of 3000 m.

Name: Methanocaldococcus jannaschii
Main publication: W. Jones, et al.,  1983,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 136,  p. 254
Description: Hydrothermal vent effluent waters and sedimentary material adjacent to vents were collected in April and May, 1982 from the East Pacific Rise at 20° 50' N latitude and 109° 06' W longitude at a depth of 2600 m.

Name: Methanocaldococcus villosus
Main publication: A. Bellack et al.,  2011,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 61,  p.1239
Description: Samples from the Kolbeinsey Ridge (Fricke et al., 1989), north of Iceland (67° 05' N,  18° 42' W), by the research submersible Jago at a depth of 105 m.

Name: Methanocaldococcus vulcanius
Main publication: C. Jeanthon et al.,  1999,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 49,  p. 583
Description: Samples from chimney from the hydrothermal field (12°48' N, 103°56' W), on the East Pacific Rise at a depth of 2600 m.

Name: Methanocella arvoryzae
Main publication: S. Sakai et al.,  2010,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 60,  p. 2918
Description: Sample from a rice field soil in Italy.

Name: Methanocella conradii
Main publication: Z. Lu et al.,  2012,  J. Bacteriol.,  vol. 194,  p. 2398
Description: Chinese rice field soil.

Name: Methanocella paludicola
Main publication: S. Sakai et al.,  2008,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 58,  p. 929
Description: Sample isolated from a rice paddy soil at Nagaoka, Niigata, Japan.

Name: Methanococcoides alaskense
Main publication: N. Singh et al.,  2005,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 55,  p.2531
Description: Sample from permanently cold, anoxic marine sediments at Skan Bay, Alaska.

Name: Methanococcoides burtonii
Main publication: P. Franzmann et al.,  1992,  Syst. Appl. Microbiol.,  vol. 15,  p. 573
Description: Sample from the anoxic hypolimnion of Ace Lake, Antarctica.

Name: Methanococcoides methylutens
Main publication: K. Sowers et al.,  1983,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 45,  p. 684
Description: Sediment (0 to 60 cm) obtained by a diver assisted with SCUBA at a depth of 65 feet (ca. 19.8 m) from the Sumner branch of Scripps Canyon located near La Jolla, California.

Name: Methanococcoides vulcani
Main publication: S. L'Haridon et al.
Description: Samples from deep sediment covered by an orange microbial mat collected from the Napoli Mud Volcano.

Name: Methanococcus aeolicus
Main publication: M. Kendall et al.,  2006,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 57,  p. 1525
Description: Sample of sediment taken from the Nankai Trough near the coast of Japan.

Name: Methanococcus maripaludis
Main publication: W. Jones et al.,  1983,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 135,  p. 91
Description: Grab samples of sediment (top 10 cm) from the tall Spartina alterniflora region of Pawley's Island salt marsh, South Carolina.

Name: Methanococcus vannielii
Main publication: T. Stadtman et al.,  1951,  J. Bacteriol.,  vol. 62,  p. 269
Description: Sample of a black mud from the east shore of San Francisco Bay.

Name: Methanococcus voltae
Main publication: W. Belch et al.,  1989,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 39,  p. 493
Min. growth requierments: Ni, Fe, Co, Mg, Ca, SeO4, CO2, 2methylbutyrate, propionate, isoleucine, leucine
Description: A sediment sample obtained near the mouth of the Waccasassa estuary in western Florida.

Name: Methanocorpusculum aggregans
Main publication: B. Ollivier et al.,  1985,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 35,  p. 127
Description: Sample from a sewage sludge digestor at Bourg en Bresse, France.

Name: Methanocorpusculum bavaricum
Main publication: G. Zellner et al.,  1989,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 151,  p. 381
Description: Sample of anaerobic sediment of a wastewater treatment pond of the sugar factory in Regensburg (FRG).

Name: Methanocorpusculum labreanum
Main publication: Y. Zhao et al.,  1989,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 39,  p. 10
Description: Sample collected from an active, gas-producing area of Tar Pit Lake at the LaBrea Tar Pits in Los Angeles, California.

Name: Methanocorpusculum parvum
Main publication: G. Zellner et al.,  1987,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 147,  p. 13
Other substrate: not supporting: pyruvate, lactate, fumarate, butyrate, 2-pentanol, formaldehyde, alanine, leucine
Description: Sample from an anaerobic sour whey digester, originally inoculated with sewage sludge.

Name: Methanocorpusculum sinense
Main publication: G. Zellner et al.,  1989,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 151,  p. 381
Description: Sample of the effluent of a fixed-bed pilot fermentation plant for anaerobic treatment of distillery wastes, operated at the Biogas Research and Training Centre of Asia and the Pacific in Chengdu, Sichuan, China.

Name: Methanoculleus bourgensis
Main publication: B. Ollivier et al.,  1986,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 36,  p. 297
Description: Samples from a digestor fermenting tannery by-products which was originally inoculated with digested sewage sludge from Bourg, or Bourg-en- Bresse, France.

Name: Methanoculleus chikugoensis
Main publication: D. Dianou et al.,  2001,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 51,  p. 1663
Min. growth requierments: yeast extract, tripticase peptone, casitone, acetate
Description: Paddy field plot (Gray Lowland Soil) with long- term application of rice straw compost at the Kyushu National Agricultural Experiment Station, Chikugo, Fukuoka, Japan.

Name: Methanoculleus horonobensis
Main publication: S. Shimizu et al.,  2013,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 63,  p. 4320
Description: The groundwater sample collected from the Wakkanai formation, a Miocene diatomaceous shale in northernmost Japan.

Name: Methanoculleus hydrogenitrophicus
Main publication: J. Tian et al.,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 60,  p. 2165
Description: Sample from the Zoige wetland, China.

Name: Methanoculleus marisnigri
Main publication: J. Romesser et al.,  1979,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 121,  p. 147
Other publication: H. Zabel et al.,   1984,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 37,  p. 308
Description: Sediment collected at station 1355 on R. V, Chain cruise 120/1 in the Black Sea.

Name: Methanoculleus palmolei
Main publication: G. Zellner et al.,  1998,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 48,  p. 1111
Description: Sample from a biogas reactor of a palm oil plant on North-Sumatra (Indonesia), which was operated at 55 °C.

Name: Methanoculleus receptaculi
Main publication: L. Cheng et al.,  2008,  FEMS Microbiol. Lett.,  vol. 285,  p. 65
Description: Sample of oil production water from Block L801 of Shengli oil field in China.

Name: Methanoculleus sediminis
Main publication: Sheng-Chung Chen et al.,  2015,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 65,  p. 2141–2147
Description: It was isolated from sediments collected by Ocean Researcher I cruise ORI-934 in 2010 near the submarine mud volcano MV4 located at the upper slope of south-west Taiwan.

Name: Methanoculleus submarinus
Main publication: J. Mikucki et al.,  2003,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 69,  p. 3311
Description: Sample from a core (BH-1) from a depth of 247 m below the sediment surface, Nankai Trough (water depth 950 m).

Name: Methanoculleus thermophilus
Main publication: C. Rivard et al.,  1982,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 32,  p. 430
Description: Sediment underlying the high-temperature effluent channel of the Crystal River Nuclear Power Plant, Florida Power Company, Crystal River, Florida.

Name: Methanofollis aquaemaris
Main publication: M. Lai et al.,  2001,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 51,  p. 1873
Description: Water sample from marine aquaculture fish pond near Wong-gong, Taiwan.

Name: Methanofollis ethanolicus
Main publication: H. Imachi et al.,  2009,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 59,  p. 800
Description: Sample from lotus field mud at Nagaoka, Niigata, Japan.

Name: Methanofollis formosanus
Main publication: S. Wu et al.,  2005,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 55,  p. 837
Description: Sample from a marine water aquaculture fish pond near Wang-gong, Taiwan.

Name: Methanofollis liminatans
Main publication: G. Zellner et al.,  1990,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 153,  p. 287
Description: Sample of anaerobically treated waste water, obtained from a Biohochreaktor of Hoechst company (Kelsterbach, Frankfurt/ Main, FRG).

Name: Methanofollis tationis
Main publication: H. Zabel et al.,  1984,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 37,  p. 308
Min. growth requierments: acetate, yeast extract, peptone, heavy metal solution
Description: Mud samples from a small (Atacama desert in Northern Chile close to the oasis of San Petro di Atacama on Mount Tatio at an altitude of 4750 m).

Name: Methanogenium boonei
Main publication: M. Kendall et al.,  2007,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 73,  p. 407
Description: Sample of sediments of Skan Bay (depth 65 m), Alaska (53°N, 167°W).

Name: Methanogenium cariaci
Main publication: J. Romesser et al.,  1979,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 121,  p. 147
Other publication: H. Zabel et al.,   1984,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 37,  p. 308
Description: Sediment collected at station 2030 on R. V. Atlantis II cruise 79 in the Cariaco Trench.

Name: Methanogenium frigidum
Main publication: P. Franzmann et al.,  1997,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 47,  p. 1068
Description: Sample of sediment from Ace Lake (68°24' S, 78°11' E)  in the Vestfold Hills of Antarctica.

Name: Methanogenium marinum
Main publication: S. Chong et al.,  2002,  Antonie Van Leeuwenhoek,  vol. 81,  p. 263
Min. growth requierments: acetate, thiamine, riboflavin, vitamin B12, peptones
Description: Sample of sediments of Skan Bay, Alaska (53°N, 167°W).

Name: Methanogenium organophilum
Main publication: F. Widdel et al.,  1988,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 150,  p. 477
Description: Sediment sample from a deep sea hydrothermal area (-2003 Im) at Guaymas Basin (Baja California).

Name: Methanohalobium evestigatum
Main publication: T. Zhilina et al.,  1987,  Dokl. Akad. Nauk SSSR,  vol. 293,  p. 464
Description: Sample of sediments of saline lagoons in Sivash.

Name: Methanohalophilus euhalobius
Main publication: I. Davidova et al.,  1987,  Antonie Van Leeuwenhoek,  vol. 71,  p. 313
Description: Mineralized stratal waters of oil deposits (Tataria, Russia).

Name: Methanohalophilus halophilus
Main publication: T. Zhilina et al.,  1984,  Mikrobiologiya,  vol. 52,  p. 375
Other publication: T. Wilharm et al.,  1991,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 41,  p. 558
Description: Sample from marine cyanobacterial mat.

Name: Methanohalophilus levihalophilus
Main publication: T. Katayama et al.,  2014,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  in press
Description: Sample from natural gas-bearing confined aquifers recharged by paleo-seawater in the Minami-Kanto gas field, Japan.

Name: Methanohalophilus mahii
Main publication: J. Paterek et al.,  1988,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 38,  p. 122
Description: Sample from the sediments of Great Salt Lake in Utah (thermal lake).

Name: Methanohalophilus portucalensis
Main publication: D. Boone et al.,  1993,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 43,  p. 430
Description: Sample of sediments from a salinarium in Figiera da Foz, Portugal.

Name: Methanolacinia paynteri
Main publication: C. Rivard et al.,  1983,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 46,  p. 484
Description: Sediments cores taken along the edges of the mosquito control canals within mangrove swamps located southeast of Georgetown, Grand Cayman, British West Indies.

Name: Methanolinea mesophila
Main publication: S. Sakai et al.,  2012,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 62,  p. 1389
Description: Sample from rice field soil in Tainan, Taiwan.

Name: Methanolinea tarda
Main publication: H. Imachi et al.,  2008,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 58,  p. 294
Description: Sample from a mesophilic, methanogenic sludge digesting sewage sludge.

Name: Methanolobus bombayensis
Main publication: P. Kadam et al.,  1994,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 44,  p. 603
Description: Sample isolated from Arabian Sea sediments obtained near Bombay, India.

Name: Methanolobus oregonensis
Main publication: Y. Liu et al.,  1990,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 40,  p. 111
Description: Sample from a slurry of subsurface solids from a saline, alkaline aquifer (West Alkali Lake, south central Oregon).

Name: Methanolobus profundi
Main publication: H. Mochimaru et al.,  2009,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 59,  p. 714
Description: Sample from deep subsurface sediments from a natural gas field filled with ancient seawater (Mobara, Japan).

Name: Methanolobus psychrophilus
Main publication: G. Zhang et al.,  2008,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 74,  p. 6114
Description: no data

Name: Methanolobus taylorii
Main publication: R. Oremland et al.,  1989,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 55,  p. 994
Description: Smple of estuarine sediments from San Francisco Bay.

Name: Methanolobus tindarius
Main publication: H. Konig et al.,  1982,  Zentralbl. Bakteriol. Mikrobiol. Hyg. [B],  vol. 3,  p. 478
Description: A marine, mesophilic.

Name: Methanolobus vulcani
Main publication: P. Kadam et al.,  1995,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 45,  p. 400
Description: Sample of sea sediments near Vulcano Island, Italy.

Name: Methanolobus zinderi
Main publication: S. Doerfert et al.,  2009,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 59,  p. 1064
Description: Water sample from coal seam near Monroe, Los Angeles, USA.

Name: Methanomassiliicoccus luminyensis
Main publication: B. Dridi et al.,  2012,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 62,  p. 1902
Description: Sample of human faeces collected in Marseille, France.

Name: Methanomethylovorans hollandica
Main publication: B. Lomans et al.,  1999,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 65,  p. 3641
Description: Sample of eutrophic pond sediment (Campus of Dek- kerswald Institute, Nijmegen, The Netherlands).

Name: Methanomethylovorans thermophila
Main publication: B. Jiang et al.,  2005,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 55,  p. 2465
Description: Sample of a sludge from thermophilic laboratory-scale upflow anaerobic sludge blanket reactor fed with methanol.

Name: Methanomethylovorans uponensis
Main publication: I. Cha et al.,  2013, Antonie Van Leeuwenhoek,  vol. 104,  p. 1005
Description: Sample of sediments from Upo wetland sediment in the Republic of Korea.

Name: Methanomicrobium mobile
Main publication: M. Paynter et al.,  1968,  J. Bacteriol.,  vol. 95,  p. 1943
Description: Sample of bovine rumen fluid.

Name: Methanomicrococcus blatticola
Main publication: W. Sprenger et al.,  2000,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 50,  p. 1989
Description: Sample isolated from Periplaneta americana var. Amsterdam, which was caught in Artis Zoo (Amsterdam, The Netherlands).

Name: Methanoplanus endosymbiosus
Main publication: J. van Bruggen et al.,  1986,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 144,  p. 367
Description: Endosymbionts in the marine ciliate Metopus contortus Quennerstedt.

Name: Methanoplanus limicola
Main publication: G. Wildgruber et al.,  1982,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 132,  p. 31
Description: Sample of swamp drilling waste in Italy.

Name: Methanoplanus petrolearius
Main publication: B. Ollivier et al.,  1997,  FEMS Microbiol. Lett.,  vol. 147,  p. 51
Other publication: E. Brambilla et al.,  2010,  Standards in Genomic Sciences,  vol. 3
Description: Sample collected from the well-head of an offshore oil field of the Gult of Guinea, West Africa.

Name: Methanopyrus kandleri
Main publication: M. Kurr et al.,  1991,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 156,  p. 239
Description: Samples from a hydrothermally heated deep sea sediment (Guaymas Basin, Gulf of California) and from a shallow marine hydrothermal system (Kolbeinsey ridge, Iceland).

Name: Methanoregula boonei
Main publication: S. Brauer et al.,  2011,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 61,  p. 45
Min. growth requierments: acetate, coenzym M, vitamins, yeast extract
Description: Sample from McLean bog, an acidic (pH 4.0–4.5) and ombrotrophic (rain-fed) site near Ithaca, NY, USA (42° 30' N, 76° 30' W).

Name: Methanoregula formicica
Main publication: Y. Yashiro et al.,  2011,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 61,  p. 53
Description: Sample from a mesophilic, granular sludge in a UASB reactor used to treat a beer brewery effluent (Japan).

Name: Methanosaeta concilii
Main publication: G. Patel et al.,  1990,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 40,  p. 79
Other collections: JCM 10134, BCRC 16173, CCRC 16173, NBRC 103675, NRC 2989, OCM 69, OGC 69
Description: Sample from pear waste fermentor inoculated with anaerobic sludge from the Regional Municipality of Ottawa-Carleton sewage treatment facility.

Name: Methanosaeta harundinacea
Main publication: K. Ma et al.,  2006,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 56,  p. 127
Description: Samples from mesophilic UASB anaerobic digester treating beer-manufacture wastewater (Beijing, China).

Name: Methanosaeta pelagica
Main publication: K. Mori et al.,  2012,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 78,  p. 3416
Description: Sample from a tidal flat sediment in Tokyo Bay, Chiba Prefecture, Japan.

Name: Methanosaeta thermophila
Main publication: G. Patel et al.,  1990,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 40,  p. 79
Description: Sample from a thermophilic anaerobic digestor.

Name: Methanosalsum zhilinae
Main publication: I. Mathrani et al.,  1988,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 38,  p. 139
Additional growth requierments: trypticase, peptone, yeast extract, rument fluid
Description: Sample from alkaline, saline sediments from Bosa Lake in the Wadi el Natrun, Egyp.

Name: Methanosarcina acetivorans
Main publication: K. Sowers et al.,  1983,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 47,  p. 971
Description: Sample of marine sediments from the Sumner branch of Scripps Canyon located near La Jolla, California.

Name: Methanosarcina baltica
Main publication: D. von Klein et al.,  2002,  Extremophiles,  vil. 6,  p. 103
Other publication: N. Singh et al.,  2005,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 55,  p.2531
Description: Sample from the anoxic surface layer of the sediment at a depth of 241 m in the Gotland Deep of the Baltic Sea.

Name: Methanosarcina barkeri
Main publication: M. Bryant et al.,  1987,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 37,  p. 169
Other publication: G. Meastrojuan et al.,  1991,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 41,  p. 267
Other collections: JCM 10043, NBRC 100474, OCM 38, VKM B-1635, BCRC 16175, CCRC 16175
Additional growth requierments: H2/C02, methanol,  mono-, di-, a trimethylamine, acetate,  CO/H2
Description: Sample from anaerobic sewage digester.

Name: Methanosarcina horonobensis
Main publication: S. Shimizu et al.,  2011,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 61,  p. 2503
Description: Sample of a groundwater from the Wakkanai Formation.

Name: Methanosarcina lacustris
Main publication: M. Simankova et al.,  2001,  Syst. Appl. Microbiol.,  vol. 24,  p. 362
Description: Sample from from anoxic lake sediments (Switzerland).

Name: Methanosarcina mazei
Main publication: R. Mah,  1980,  Curr. Microbiol.,  vol. 3,  p. 321
Other publication: G. Meastrojuan et al.,  1991,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 41,  p. 267
Description: Sample from sewage sludge plant.

Name: Methanosarcina semesiae
Main publication: T. Lyimo et al.,  2000,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 50,  p. 171
Description: Sample of  sediments obtained from the mangrove forest at Monti creek, Dar es Salaam, Tanzania (Indian Ocean).

Name: Methanosarcina siciliae
Main publication: S. Ni et al.,  1991,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 41,  p. 410
Description: Sample of water collected from an offshore production platform receiving liquid and gas from oil well HI350 at High Island in the Gulf of Mexico.

Name: Methanosarcina soligelidi
Main publication: D. Wagner et al.,  2013,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 63,  p. 2986
Other collections: JCM 18468, CIP 107090, LMG 15061, NCDO 2477, NCFB 2477, NCIMB 702477, Stetter 65
Description: Samples of a permafrost-affected soil on Samoylov Island, Lena Delta, Siberia.

Name: Methanosarcina spelaei
Main publication: L. Ganzert et al,  2014,  Int J Syst Evol Microbiol,  Vol. 64,  P. 3478-3484
Description: Microorganism was isolated from a floating biofilm on a sulphurous subsurface lake in Movile Cave (Mangalia, Romania)

Name: Methanosarcina thermophila
Main publication: S. Zinder et al.,  1979,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 38,  p. 996
Other publication: S. Zinder et al.,  1985,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 35,  p. 522
Description: Sample from labortory anaerobic sludge digestor (55°C) inoculated with sludge from thermophilic digestor operated at Hyperion sewage treatment plant, El Segundo, California.

Name: Methanosarcina vacuolata
Main publication: T. Zhilina et al.,  1987,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 37,  p. 281
Other publication: G. Meastrojuan et al.,  1991,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 41,  p. 267
Description: Sludge sample from mesophilic anaerobic digestor in Moscow.

Name: Methanosphaera cuniculi
Main publication: B. Biavati et al.,  1988,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 54,  p. 768
Description: Samples from rabbit caeca, colons, or rectums, animals were hybrids of a New Zealand White female rabbit and a California male rabbit.

Name: Methanosphaera stadtmanae
Main publication: T. Miller et al.,  1985,  Arch. Microbiol.,  vol. 141,  p. 116
Description: Sample of human feces.

Name: Methanosphaerula palustris
Main publication: H. Cadillo-Quiroz et al.,  2009,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 59,  p. 928
Other publication: H. Cadillo-Quiroz et al.,  2008,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 74,  p. 2059
Description: Sample from minerotrophic fen peatland, Michigan Hollow (New York State (42°21' N, 76°28' W)).

Name: Methanospirillum hungatei
Main publication: J. Ferry et al., 1974,  Int. J. Syst. Bacteriol.,  vol. 24,  p. 465
Description: Sample of sewage sludge.

Name: Methanospirillum lacunae
Main publication: T. Iino et al.,  2010,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 60,  p. 2563
Description: Soil sample collected from a puddle at Kisarazu, Chiba, Japan.

Name: Methanospirillum psychrodurum
Main publication: L. Zhou et al.,  2014,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 64,  p. 638
Description: Soil from Madoi wetland at Qinghai-Tibetan plateau, China.

Name: Methanospirillum stamsii
Main publication: S. Parshina et al.,  2014,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 64,  p. 180
Description: Sample of granulated biomass of a two-stage low-temperature (3–8 °C) anaerobic expanded granular sludge bed (EGSB) bioreactor, fed with a mixture of volatile fatty acids (VFAs) (acetate, propionate and butyrate).

Name: Methanothermobacter crinale
Main publication: L. Cheng et al.,  2008,  Appl. Environ. Microbiol.,  vol. 77,  p. 5212
Description: Sample of production water of oil reservoirs was collected from the Shengli oil fiel.

Name: Methanothermobacter defluvii
Main publication: S. Kotelnikova et al.,  1993,  Syst. Appl. Microbiol.,  vol. 16,  p. 427
Description: Sludge samples from the anaerobic digestor sludge operating on waste waters containing methacrylates.

Name: Methanothermobacter marburgensis
Main publication: A. Wasserfallen et al.,  2000,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 50,  p. 43
Description: Sample of mesophilic sewage sludge.

Name: Methanothermobacter tenebrarum
Main publication: K. Nakamura et al.,  2013,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 63,  p. 715
Min. growth requierments: casamino acids, tryptone, yeast extract, or vitamins for growth
Description: Sample from gas-associated formation water of a gas-producing well in a natural gas field at Niigata, Japan.

Name: Methanothermobacter thermautotrophicus
Main publication: J. Zeikus et al.,  1972,  J. Bacteriol.,  vol. 109,  p. 707
Other publication: A. Wasserfallen et al.,  2000,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 50,  p. 43
Description: Sample from fermenting sludge obtained from the sewage treatment plant of the city of Urbana, Illinois.

Name: Methanothermobacter thermoflexus
Main publication: S. Kotelnikova et al.,  1993,  Syst. Appl. Microbiol.,  vol. 16,  p. 427
Description: Sludge samples from the anaerobic digestor sludge operating on waste waters containing methacrylates.

Name: Methanothermobacter thermophilus
Main publication: K. Laurinavichus et al.,  1988,  Mikrobiologiya,  vol. 57,  p. 1035
Description: Sample from thermophilic methane tank (USSR).

Name: Methanothermobacter wolfeii
Main publication: J. Winter et al.,  2000,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 50,  p. 43
Description: Sample of a a mixture of sewage sludge and river sediment.

Name: Methanothermococcus okinawensis
Main publication: K. Takai et al.,  2002,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 52,  p. 1089
Description: Sample from a deep-sea hydrothermal vent chimney obtained from the hydrothermal field at Iheya Ridge in the Okinawa Trough, Japan (27° 47.220' N, 126° 53.900' E) at a depth of 972 m.

Name: Methanothermococcus thermolithotrophicus
Main publication: H. Huber et al.,  1982,  Arch. Mikrobiol.,  vol. 132,  p. 47
Description: Sample from the sandy geothermally heated sea floor of the beach at Stufe di Nerone close to Naples (italy), about 3 m away from the shore in about 0.5 m depth.

Name: Methanothermus fervidus
Main publication: K. Stetter et al.,  1981,  Zentralbl. Mikrobiol.,  vol. 178,  p. 166
Description: Samples from Icelandic volcanic spring and mud holes with temperatures around 100 °C.

Name: Methanothermus sociabilis
Main publication: G. Lauerer et al.,  1986,  Syst. Appl. Microbiol.,  vol. 8,  p. 100
Description: Sample from solfatara fields in Iceland.

Name: Methanotorris formicicus
Main publication: K. Takai et al.,  2004,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 54,  p. 1095
Description: Sample from a black smoker chimney at the Kairei field in the Central Indian Ridge.

Name: Methanotorris igneus
Main publication: S. Burggraf et al.,  1990,  Syst. Appl. Microbiol.,  vol. 13,  p. 263
Description: Sample from a shallow (depth: 106 m) submarine vent system at the Kolbeinsey ridge, Iceland.

Name: Methermicoccus shengliensis
Main publication: L. Cheng et al.,  2007,  Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol.,  vol. 57,  p. 2964
Description: Sample of oil-production water of Shengli oilfield, China.

Name: Methanosarcina flavescens
Main publication: T. Kern et al.,  2016. Int J Syst Evol Microbiol vol. 66 p. 1533
Description: Sample from anaerobic fed with maize silage, cattle manure and dry pultry faeces
